title: for Credit Transfers and Direct Debits in Euro) (Amendment) Regulations 2025.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Requirements
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Requirements 
for Credit Transfers and Direct Debits in Euro) (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 9 January 2025.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (requirements credit transfer direct debit euro) (amendment) regulation 2025 (2) regulation shall come operation 9 january 2025

title: for Credit Transfers and Direct Debits in Euro) (Amendment) Regulations 2025.
heading: 2. The European Union (Requirements for Credit Transfers and Direct
text_raw:
2. The European Union (Requirements for Credit Transfers and Direct 
Debits in Euro) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 132 of 2013) are amended by the 
insertion of the following Regulation after Regulation 11: 

“Administrative penalties 

(1) 

11A. 
Act 1942 (No. 22 of 1942). 

In this Regulation, “Act of 1942” means the Central Bank 

(2) Where the provisions of the Act of 1942 are invoked in 
relation to a contravention of Article 5d of the SEPA Regulation, any of 
the administrative penalties referred to in paragraph (5) may be imposed 
by the Bank – 

(a) following an inquiry under section 33AO of the Act 

of 1942, or 

(b) in accordance with section 33AR or 33AV of the Act 

of 1942. 

(3) 

Subject to paragraph (4), the power of the Bank to impose 
any of the administrative penalties referred to in paragraph (2) is in 
addition to and not in substitution for its power to impose any of the 
sanctions specified in section 33AQ of the Act of 1942. 

(4) Where the sanction imposed by the Bank is a direction to 
a legal person to pay a monetary penalty under section 33AQ(3)(c) of the 
Act of 1942, the amount of that penalty shall not exceed the amount of 
the maximum administrative fine calculated in accordance with 
paragraph (5)(a). 

1 OJ No. L 94, 30.3.2012, p. 22 
2 OJ L 886, 19.3.2024 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th January, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [6] 3 

(5) 

The administrative penalties referred to in each of 

paragraphs (2) and (7) are the following: 

(a) 

the case of a 

in 
legal person, maximum 
administrative fines of 10 per cent of the total 
annual net turnover of the body for its last 
complete financial year; 

(b) 

in the case of a natural person, maximum 
administrative fines of €5,000,000. 

(6) 

For the purposes of paragraph (5)(a), where the legal 
person is a subsidiary of a parent undertaking, as defined in Article 2, 
point (9), of Directive 2013/34/EU of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 26 June 20133, or of any undertaking which effectively 
exercises a dominant influence over that legal person, the relevant 
turnover shall be the turnover resulting from the consolidated accounts 
of the ultimate parent undertaking in the preceding business year. 

(7) 

For the purposes of a contravention referred to in 
paragraph (2), any reference in the Act of 1942 to the sanctions set out in 
section 33AQ of that Act is to be read as including a reference to the 
administrative penalties referred to in paragraph (5).”. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister 
for Finance, 

8 January, 2025. 

JACK CHAMBERS, 

Minister for Finance. 

3 OJ L 182, 29.6.2013, p. 19
